newsitem.title: GERMANY: Pension changes lead to growth in managed funds.
newsitem.headline: Pension changes lead to growth in managed funds.

text.p: The first half of 1996 saw a 16 percent rise to 59.5 billion marks in the amount invested in German equity-backed investment funds, Deutsche Bank AG's investment wing, DWS, said in a report.
"Capital investments within the private pension provision framework are set to become an increasingly important factor in the funds market," DWS said in a statement.
Overall, total capital investment in German investment funds, including Luxembourg, increased by four percent in the first half of 1996 to 347.3 billion marks, the DWS report said.
"Particularly interesting to investors were equity-backed funds with capital guarantees," the report said.
Levels of investment in bond-backed products actually fell in the six-month period.
The report said that market expectations of volatile returns in long-term investments fuelled the 1.9 percent decline in the amount invested in bond-backed funds to 111 billion marks.
Money market funds, legalised in the autumn of 1994, saw a decline of 3.2 percent in the half-year. Mixed funds, especially those with tax optimisation aspects, grew by 2.1 percent in the period.
